title: China’s EV Boom Has a Dark Side: Thousands of Dealerships Are Shutting Down
description: China’s auto dealers are facing their toughest moment in decades as the rapid shift to electric vehicles, overcapacity, and intense price wars squeeze profits to the brink. Once a vital link between automakers and consumers, the country’s 4S dealerships (sales, service, spare parts, and surveys) ...
titleSummary: China's Electric Dream Turns to Dust as Thousands of Car Dealerships Close Overnight
descriptionSummary: China's auto dealers are navigating a perfect storm of challenges, as the electric vehicle revolution, oversaturated markets, and brutal price competition threaten to decimate their profits. The country's 4S shops, once the linchpin of car sales, now face an uncertain future.

title: Toyota Drops Accord-Beating Camry Lease Deal For October

title: First Look at 2027 Hyundai Santa Fe Interior
description: New spy images reveal the 2027 Hyundai Santa Fe's contemporary design and refreshed interiors.

title: $35K Dilemma: Would You Buy a 278K-Mile Mercedes G-Wagen or a New Toyota Camry?
description: The Mercedes-Benz G-Class has evolved from a military workhorse into a status symbol, but underneath all that glitz remains one of the most capable off-roaders ever built. There aren’t many cars that can hit the trail one day and be one of the most recognizable luxury status symbols on the planet ...
titleSummary: "Trade-Off Tactic: 278K-Mile Luxury Ride vs. Brand-New Family Sedan for Under $40,000"
descriptionSummary: From rugged origins to luxurious icon, the Mercedes-Benz G-Class has traded its utilitarian roots for high-end status, yet beneath its glamorous facade lies a vehicle of unparalleled off-road prowess.

title: Kia’s New Battery Tech Could Save EV Owners Thousands in Repairs
description: Battery-monitoring system checks individual cells for problemsKia says this allows for more targeted repairs, saving customers moneyEuropean Union will require battery-health monitoring starting in 2027 Most of the value of an electric vehicle is tied up in its battery pack, so ensuring that pack ...
titleSummary: "Kia's Groundbreaking Battery Upgrade Puts an End to Costly Electric Vehicle Fixes"
descriptionSummary: A cutting-edge battery health check system identifies and addresses individual cell issues before they cause damage, enabling efficient and cost-effective repairs. This technology is set to become mandatory in European Union vehicles by 2027.

title: Jaguar Land Rover Bounces Back from Month-Long Shutdown
description: JLR faces $2.67 billion losses from cyberattack; Wolverhampton and Solihull plants now operational.
titleSummary: "Jaguar Land Rover Roars to Life After Extended Factory Downtime"
descriptionSummary: Jaguar Land Rover's production has slowly resumed after a devastating cyberattack forced a temporary shutdown of its Wolverhampton and Solihull factories, while the company grapples with estimated damages exceeding $2.67 billion.

title: Bentley Recalls Continental and Flying Spur Over Fuel Leak Fire Risk
description: Bentley has issued a recall for select 2025 and 2026 Continental GT, Continental GTC, and Flying Spur models after identifying a potential fire risk linked to the fuel system. The recall affects just 17 vehicles in the United States, underscoring how even limited-production luxury cars ...

descriptionSummary: Bentley has issued a voluntary safety notice for select 2025-26 Continental GT, GTC, and Flying Spur models due to a potential fire hazard associated with their fuel system, affecting only 17 vehicles in the US market.

title: Xiaomi Takes Aim at Porsche With Its Own “Paint to Sample” Program
description: Porsche faces a myriad of problems in China. For one, the brand’s cars are somewhat niche by design, which means they capture a small share of the market. descriptionSummary: Porsche's struggles in China are multifaceted, but one major issue is that its luxury cars cater to a specific taste, limiting their appeal to a smaller segment of the market. A more significant challenge lies with local manufacturers dominating the landscape.

title: Mercedes Sales Take a Hit — China's EV Boom and Tariffs to Blame
description: Mercedes-Benz reported a steep drop in third-quarter sales, with global deliveries falling 12 percent year over year to 525,300 vehicles. descriptionSummary: Mercedes-Benz experienced a significant decline in global sales during the third quarter, with deliveries plummeting 12 percent year-over-year to 525,300 vehicles. Weakness in key markets like China and the US drove the downturn, impacting passenger car and van sales.

descriptionSummary: BMW's 2025 financial projections have been adjusted downward due to slower growth in China, delayed compensation for tariffs, and increasing import expenses. As a result, the company expects reduced pre-tax earnings and a lower return on investment for its core automotive business.
